sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Nuvve, E&B Renewables plan joint Nordic, Baltic battery rollout
feed.summary: Nuvve and E&B Renewables have partnered to deploy battery energy storage systems (BESS) across the Nordic and Baltic regions. The initiative aims to support grid stability and integrate renewable energy sources in these markets. This collaboration signifies a strategic move to expand energy storage infrastructure in Northern Europe.

feed.title: Nuvve Signs Agreement with Danish Developer, E&B Renewables, to Secure Battery Energy Storage Projects in Northern Europe and Baltic Countries
feed.summary: Nuvve Denmark ApS and E&B Renewables ApS have signed a Non-Binding Memorandum of Understanding to deploy Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) in Europe, aiming to establish a diversified portfolio of stationary batteries managed by Nuvve. The partnership plans to initially deploy three 2 MW projects in Denmark, followed by an additional 20 to 50 MW of projects in Nordic and Baltic countries by early 2026. This agreement signifies Nuvve's expansion into stationary storage and microgrids, leveraging its platform to diversify revenue streams for these projects.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp. issues $111,111 convertible note and warrants to investor By Investing.com
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. has issued a $111,111 convertible promissory note and accompanying warrants to an accredited investor, aiming to secure working capital amidst significant financial challenges. The company, facing a "WEAK" financial health rating and operating with a substantial debt burden, will use the proceeds for general corporate purposes. This financing move comes as Nuvve is also strategically shifting its focus toward energy storage systems and microgrids, and recently announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split to regain Nasdaq compliance.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp. issues $111,111 convertible note and warrants to investor By Investing.com
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:NVVE) announced it has issued a $111,111 convertible promissory note and warrants to an accredited investor. This financing is critical for the company, which faces significant financial challenges including a substantial debt burden and negative EBITDA, as outlined by InvestingPro data. The company plans to use the net proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes, while also working on a strategic shift towards energy storage and microgrids.

feed.title: Nuvve Signs Agreement with Danish Developer, E&B Renewables, to Secure Battery Energy Storage Projects in Northern Europe and Baltic Countries
feed.summary: Nuvve Denmark ApS and E&B Renewables ApS have signed a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to deploy Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) across Northern Europe and Baltic countries. The partnership aims to develop a diversified portfolio of stationary batteries ranging from 2 MW to 100 MW, with initial projects planned for Denmark and future expansion into the Nordic and Baltic markets. This collaboration leverages Nuvve's grid asset management technology to maximize revenue streams and de-risk investments in the green energy transition.

feed.title: Nuvve Signs Agreement with Danish Developer, E&B Renewables, to Secure Battery Energy Storage Projects in Northern Europe and Baltic Countries
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) has signed a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with E&B Renewables ApS to deploy Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) across Europe, particularly in Northern Europe and Baltic countries. The agreement builds on previous collaborations and aims to develop a diversified portfolio of stationary batteries managed by Nuvve, with initial projects targeting Denmark and subsequent expansion into other Nordic and Baltic regions. This partnership signifies Nuvve's strategic expansion into stationary storage and microgrids, leveraging its grid asset management technology for risk mitigation and revenue diversification.

feed.title: Nuvve Releases Letter to Stockholders, Expands Strategic Focus to Energy Storage and Grid Support to Drive Near-Term Growth
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. announced a strategic expansion to include stationary energy storage systems and microgrids, broadening its focus beyond vehicle-to-grid (V2G) technology. This move aims to capitalize on faster-growing energy markets while utilizing Nuvve's existing sophisticated grid management platform. The company's immediate growth strategy targets Northern Europe, the United States, Japan, and South Korea, which are experiencing rapid electrification and demand for distributed energy resources.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding expands focus to stationary energy storage systems, microgrids
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding (NVVE) announced a strategic expansion to include stationary energy storage systems and microgrids, broadening its market focus beyond vehicle-to-grid innovation. This move positions the company to leverage growth in more mature energy markets. Nuvve's technology platform, originally designed for grid services via electric vehicle batteries, will now also support these new energy applications.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp Expands Focus to Energy Storage and Microgrids
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp announced a strategic shift towards energy storage and microgrids on December 18, 2025. This pivot aims for immediate revenue through small to mid-sized projects, with plans for blockchain integration in 2026 and existing projects in Europe, Japan, and the US. The company emphasizes reducing reliance on equity financings to improve cash flow.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Announces 1-for-40 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective December 15, 2025, to meet Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This move will significantly reduce outstanding shares while maintaining total authorized shares. Despite strategic expansions, the company faces challenges in profitability and cash flow, leading TipRanks' AI Analyst to rate NVVE as Neutral with a bearish outlook.

feed.title: Nuvve to implement 1-for-40 reverse stock split on December 15
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split, effective December 15, 2025, to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This move comes as the company's stock has plummeted nearly 95% over the past year, trading at $0.17, well below its 52-week high of $5.02. The split will reduce outstanding shares significantly and marks an effort to address financial challenges and maintain its listing status.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp. announces 1-for-40 reverse stock split effective December 15
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:NVVE) will implement a 1-for-40 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective December 15, 2025, to meet Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This move will reduce outstanding shares from 53 million to 1.3 million, with proportionate adjustments to convertible securities and options. The company is also expanding into the Korean energy storage market and recently issued a senior convertible promissory note.

feed.title: NVVE - Nuvve Holding Corp Latest Stock News & Market Updates
feed.summary: This page provides the latest news and updates for Nuvve Holding Corp (NVVE), a company specializing in vehicle-to-grid (V2G) technology. It covers corporate developments, technological breakthroughs, and strategic partnerships, including details on a reverse stock split, international market entry, and financing agreements. The information helps investors track NVVE's progress in commercializing bidirectional charging solutions and advancing clean energy infrastructure.

feed.title: Nuvve Announces 1-For-40 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective December 15, 2025, to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This will reduce outstanding shares from approximately 53 million to 1.3 million. Fractional shares will be rounded up, and proportional adjustments will be made to outstanding equity awards.

feed.title: Nuvve Announces 1-For-40 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective December 15, 2025, to boost its share price and comply with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This split will reduce outstanding shares from approximately 53 million to 1.3 million, with trading on a split-adjusted basis starting December 15, 2025. The company's CUSIP number for common stock will change, but not for its warrants, and fractional shares will be rounded up.

feed.title: Nuvve to implement 1-for-40 reverse stock split; shares down
feed.summary: Nuvve, a vehicle-to-grid technology company, announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The split will take effect at 5:00 p.m. ET on December 11, 2024, with shares trading on a split-adjusted basis starting December 12, 2024. This action aims to increase the per-share trading price, although it will not change the total value of existing shareholder equity.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp Announces 1-for-40 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split, effective December 15, 2025, to meet Nasdaq's $1.00 minimum bid price requirement. This will reduce outstanding shares from 53 million to 1.3 million, with stockholders' accounts automatically adjusted and fractional shares rounded up. The common stock will trade under the new CUSIP 67079Y407.

feed.title: Nuvve stock tumbles after announcing 1-for-40 reverse split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:NVVE) stock dropped 24% after announcing a 1-for-40 reverse stock split effective December 15, 2025. This action will reduce outstanding shares significantly and aims to bring the company into compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement of $1.00 per share. Proportional adjustments will be made to options, restricted stock units, and warrants, with fractional shares rounded up.

feed.title: Nuvve Announces 1-For-40 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective December 15, 2025, to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This will reduce outstanding shares from approximately 53 million to 1.3 million, with no change to the authorized share count. Stockholders approved the board's discretion for the split in October 2025, and the board finalized the 1-for-40 ratio in November 2025.

feed.title: Nuvve Announces 1-For-40 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective December 15, 2025, to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. This will reduce the number of outstanding shares from approximately 53 million to 1.3 million. Fractional shares will be rounded up, and proportional adjustments will be made to stock options and warrants.

feed.title: Nuvve and Volt Establish “NuvveVolt” to Enter Korea’s National-Scale ESS Market
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. has partnered with South Korea–based Volt to form "NuvveVolt" and enter Korea's national-scale Energy Storage Systems (ESS) market. This new consortium will participate in the 2025 Second-Round ESS Central Auction with the Korea Power Exchange (KPX), with a project totaling 95 MW / 570 MWh. This move marks Nuvve's formal entry into the rapidly expanding Korean energy storage market, leveraging its intelligent energy-management platform.

feed.title: Nuvve holding (NVVE) CEO Poilasne sells $73,680 in stock
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp.'s CEO, Gregory Poilasne, sold a total of 326,000 shares of common stock across three transactions between November 26 and December 1, 2025, netting $73,680. Following these sales, Poilasne directly owns over 1.3 million shares. The company has also announced significant developments, including a convertible promissory note, a private placement agreement to raise up to $50 million, and a partnership for grid modernization and transportation electrification in New Mexico.

feed.title: Nuvve Shares Explode Higher After Japan Unit Wins Major Storage Battery Aggregation Contract
feed.summary: Nuvve's shares soared after its Japanese subsidiary, Nuvve Japan, secured a significant contract for a V2G (Vehicle-to-Grid) storage battery aggregation project. This project, awarded by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, involves managing energy flow between electric vehicles and the grid, potentially enhancing grid stability and enabling renewable energy integration. The contract highlights Nuvve's growing presence in the energy management sector and its commitment to sustainable energy solutions.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding (NVVE) Stock Surges 77% After Hours — Here's Why It's Trending Tonight
feed.summary: Shares of Nuvve Holding (NASDAQ: NVVE) surged 76.78% in after-hours trading following the announcement of a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU). This agreement, signed with the City of Socorro, N.M., and Socorro Electric Cooperative, Inc., aims to modernize electric infrastructure and advance transportation electrification in the Socorro region. The partnership will focus on grid modernization, electrifying school buses, replacing municipal fleets, and integrating renewable energy solutions.

feed.title: Nuvve stock soars after partnership with Socorro to advance electrification
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp (NASDAQ:NVVE) stock surged 38.9% in after-hours trading following the announcement of a new partnership with the City of Socorro and Socorro Electric Cooperative. This collaboration aims to accelerate transportation electrification and grid modernization in New Mexico. The agreement outlines a framework for joint initiatives in areas such as school bus and municipal fleet electrification, smart rates, charging infrastructure expansion, and renewable energy integration.

feed.title: Nuvve Shares Collapse After Company Announces Private Placement and Equity Line Agreement
feed.summary: Nuvve Corporation's shares experienced a significant decline following announcements of a private placement and an equity line agreement. These financial maneuvers often lead to stock dilution, which can negatively impact existing shareholders and the stock price. The market reacted unfavorably to the news, indicating concerns about the company's financial strategy and future stock value.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:NVVE) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:NVVE) discussed its Q3 2025 earnings, highlighting a strategic shift towards stationary battery deployment with new projects in Europe and Japan. The company reported $1.6 million in total revenues for Q3 2025 and a net loss of $4.5 million. Nuvve remains confident in addressing NASDAQ's bid price and shareholder equity concerns.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp. Announces Strategic Financing to Strengthen Equity Position
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. has announced strategic financing through a private placement securities purchase agreement and an equity line of credit, aiming to strengthen its balance sheet and meet Nasdaq's minimum equity requirements. This follows shareholder approval for a reverse stock split, which addresses Nasdaq's minimum bid price rule. The company believes these steps will support its ongoing operations, future growth, and mission to advance clean energy solutions.

feed.title: Nuvve Provides Third Quarter 2025 Financial Update
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) reported its financial results for the third quarter of 2025, revealing total revenues of $1.6 million and a net loss of $4.8 million. The company raised $5.6 million in gross proceeds to support operations and achieved accelerated sales growth in the third quarter, while also expanding its stationary battery pipeline.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Corp. SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025, detailing a decrease in total revenue and significant operating and net losses compared to the previous year. Despite financial challenges, the company highlights strategic initiatives including the formation of new subsidiaries, a joint venture, and an acquisition aimed at expanding its energy solutions and V2G technology. Management plans to fund operations through increased revenues and additional capital to achieve future profitability.

feed.title: Promising Green Energy Stocks To Keep An Eye On – October 14th - Defense World
feed.summary: This article highlights three promising green energy stocks to watch: NWTN (NWTN), Nuvve (NVVE), and NWTN (NWTNW). These companies are involved in smart passenger vehicles, green energy solutions, and vehicle-to-grid technology, respectively. The article emphasizes the growth potential in these stocks due to the transition to cleaner energy, while also noting exposures to policy shifts, technology risks, and higher volatility.

feed.summary: This article reports an application error, preventing the display of content about Nuvve selling its Dreev stake to EDF and entering new licensing agreements. The complete article content was not available due to this error.

These companies are highlighted based on their highest dollar trading volume in the green energy sector recently. The article provides a brief description of each company's operations within the smart passenger vehicle and vehicle-to-grid technology sectors.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding entered into purchase agreement to sell 4.65% equity interests in Dreev to EDF - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. has entered into a purchase agreement to sell 4.65% equity interests in Dreev to EDF. This move is part of the company's strategic financial activities.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Entered Into Purchase Agreement To Sell 4.65% Equity Interests In Dreev To EDF - TradingView
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp announced that on October 8, it entered into a purchase agreement to sell a 4.65% equity interest in Dreev to EDF. This information was disclosed in an SEC filing by Nuvve Holding, whose stock symbol is NVVE.

feed.title: Nuvve sells Dreev stake to EDF and enters new licensing agreements - Investing.com India
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. sold its minority stake in Dreev SAS to EDF Développement Environnement SA for €800,000, addressing financial challenges. Concurrently, Nuvve, EDF, and Dreev entered into new software cross-license and patent assignment agreements, superseding prior arrangements and outlining intellectual property usage. These moves occur amidst Nuvve's recent shareholder approval for a reverse stock split, new contracts, and an ongoing appeal against a Nasdaq delisting notice.

feed.title: Nuvve sells Dreev stake to EDF and enters new licensing agreements - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article from Investing.com is currently experiencing an application error, preventing its content from being displayed. It appears to be about Nuvve selling its stake in Dreev to EDF and forming new licensing agreements. Due to the error, the full details of the transaction and agreements are unavailable.

feed.summary: This article highlights top green energy stocks to watch, identified by MarketBeat's stock screener tool. It details NWTN and Nuvve, providing descriptions of their operations and contributions to green energy solutions. The selections focus on companies with high dollar trading volume in the green energy sector.

feed.title: Green Energy Stocks To Add to Your Watchlist - October 13th - MarketBeat
feed.summary: MarketBeat identifies five green energy stocks—NWTN, Nuvve, NWTNW, and NVVEW—to watch, based on high dollar trading volume. The article provides a brief description of each company, focusing on their contributions to low-carbon energy solutions and electric vehicle technologies. It also notes that green energy stocks can be volatile due to sensitivity to government policy and technological changes.

feed.title: Best Green Energy Stocks To Keep An Eye On – October 11th - Defense World
feed.summary: This article highlights NWTN and Nuvve as key green energy stocks to watch, based on their high dollar trading volume. NWTN specializes in smart passenger vehicles and green energy solutions, while Nuvve focuses on vehicle-to-grid (V2G) technology for electric vehicles. Both companies operate in multiple regions and are aligned with carbon-reduction and ESG goals.

feed.title: Nuvve's Q2 Revenue Falls to $0.3M as EV Charging Company Makes Bold Crypto and AI Pivot
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (NASDAQ: NVVE) reported a significant 58.5% decrease in total revenue to $0.33 million for Q2 2025, compared to $0.80 million in Q2 2024, leading to a net loss of $13.6 million. Despite declining revenues in its traditional EV charging business, Nuvve is pivoting its strategy towards artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency, highlighted by the acquisition of Fermata, the addition of a crypto strategist to its board, and granting $8.19 million in warrants for cryptocurrency-related consulting services. The company aims to leverage its V2G technology at the intersection of energy, AI, and crypto to capitalize on new opportunities.

feed.title: Nuvve and WISE EV Partner to Create Convenient Public EV Charging Station Infrastructure in Select Markets Across the US
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. and WISE EV have partnered to deploy public high-speed EV charging stations in over 100 high-traffic locations across the U.S. These stations will integrate Nuvve’s Vehicle-to-Grid (V2G) technology to provide essential grid services. The initiative aims to address "range anxiety" and expand EV charging infrastructure, beginning with an unveiling event in Las Vegas.

feed.title: Nuvve Holding Announces 1-for-10 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nuvve Holdings Corp. announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split effective September 16, 2024. This action is intended to reduce outstanding shares from approximately 6.5 million to 0.7 million and help the company comply with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. Nuvve's stock will continue trading on Nasdaq under the symbol "NVVE" after the split.

feed.title: NUVVE HOLDING CORP. ANNOUNCES DATE OF SPECIAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: NVVE) has announced a Special Meeting of Stockholders on January 13, 2025, at 1:00 p.m. Eastern Time. Shareholders are encouraged to vote their proxy regarding matters outlined in the definitive proxy statement filed with the SEC on December 16, 2024. The record date for the meeting is December 6, 2024, and assistance with voting is available through Advantage Proxy, Inc.

feed.title: NUVVE ANNOUNCES 1-FOR-10 REVERSE STOCK SPLIT
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split to be effective on September 16, 2024, with trading on a split-adjusted basis starting September 17, 2024. This action is intended to help Nuvve regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The split will reduce the number of outstanding shares from approximately 6.5 million to 0.7 million, with proportional adjustments to equity instruments.

feed.title: Nuvve, WISE EV Partner on EV Charging Station Infrastructure
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. and WISE EV have partnered to establish over 100 EV charging stations across the U.S., with the first wave set to include high-traffic locations. These stations will feature Nuvve's vehicle-to-grid (V2G) technology, providing essential grid services and stabilizing electricity during peak usage. The partnership aims to boost EV adoption by addressing range anxiety and supporting grid stability.

feed.title: Nuvve and Great Power Announce Strategic Partnership to Accelerate Electric Vehicle Integration and Renewable Energy Adoption
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. and Guangzhou Great Power Energy and Technology Corporation have announced a strategic partnership to accelerate stationary storage battery deployments and their integration with the grid. This collaboration aims to leverage Nuvve's energy management platform with Great Power's battery technology to optimize energy usage, reduce costs, and support renewable energy integration. The integrated solution is expected to enable significant energy savings for customers, particularly in areas with high energy rates.

feed.title: San Diego County's Ramona Unified School District, Blue Bird and Nuvve Unveil 8 New V2G-Enabled and Qualified Electric School Buses
feed.summary: Ramona Unified School District, in partnership with Blue Bird Corporation and Nuvve Holding Corp., has unveiled eight new electric, zero-emission school buses powered by V2G technology. These buses, equipped with Nuvve's GIVe™ platform, can sell energy back to the grid during peak demand through SDG&E's Emergency Load Reduction Program, potentially saving the district up to $7,200 per bus annually. This initiative highlights a significant step towards sustainable transportation and grid resilience, offering financial benefits for the school district.

feed.title: Nuvve Grows Board of Directors with Appointment of Rashida La Lande from Kraft Heinz
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. announced the appointment of Rashida La Lande, Executive Vice President, Global General Counsel and Chief Sustainability and Government Affairs Officer for The Kraft Heinz Company, to its Board of Directors. La Lande brings extensive experience in ESG initiatives, government relations, legal, and M&A expertise from her background in consumer products, retail, financial services, and technology industries. Her addition is expected to significantly contribute to Nuvve's strategy and commitment to addressing climate impact through technology.

feed.title: V2G electric school bus solution deployed in Colorado
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. and Colorado/West Equipment, Inc. have deployed the first vehicle-to-grid (V2G) capable electric school bus in Colorado at Durango School District 9-R. This V2G technology, integrated into Blue Bird buses, allows bidirectional charging to send power back to the grid during peak demand and charges at night during low-rate periods. The initiative aims to provide grid flexibility, utilize low-cost renewables, and reduce operating costs for school districts.
